dialogues.text: Not exactly. I wear it. (defiantly) On my right hand. And only rarely. Just then, the door BUZZES. Kat turns. It’s Jeffrey, tugging on the handle. Sal scowls.

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: You want I nut him in the boat?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Yes? No. What? (beat) Save the patter for the tourists.

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: You want me to let him in?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Of course, don’t be silly. Sal BUZZES Jeffrey in and gives him the dirty eye before disappears into the back. KAT (CONT’D) Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Let me guess. Amy presumed I’d forget the rings. (off her look) I think I’m her least favorite person. (beat) You know, I am sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (warming) Maybe not her least... There’s always- -  63.

dialogues.speaker: KAT/ JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Ed’s mother. They share a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: So, tell me, how’s unmarried life?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I have regrets. Kat jumps down his throat, instantly abandoning her false largesse.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Whoa, Jeffrey. Slow down. You and me, we’re the past. I’m not sure if you noticed, but I’m here with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Kat, we must talk. This guy, there’s something not quite right

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: It’s called character. God, you’re predictable.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Is that why you brought him? Because of me. Kat laughs way too hard.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Don’t be absurd. Kat is about to walk out the door, but she can’t help herself. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I brought him here because he’s my boyfriend. Because I adore him. Because late at night he takes me in his arms and.... Kat leans in and whispers something into Jeffrey’s ear.  64.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’d stick around and explain what that means, but even if I give you the instruction manual, it doesn’t mean you’ve got the tools to get the job done. Kat tries not to do a little “fuck-you” jig as she walks the door. EXT. STREET - ST. JOHN’S WOOD Kat strides away but Jeffrey catches up to her. She secre smiles at the power she is exerting over him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Kat, wait. I don’t want you hating me. We’ve never had this talk. You know how crap I am at this.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Um, news flash: I don’t give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Kat, stop it. You do. You can’t even look me in the eye. You went back to the States when we split up. Jeffrey sees Kat flinch. He knows he’s hit something. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: It was. And it took your sister getting married to get you back here.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (wavering) So, what’s your point?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I should have told you why I broke up with you. I was a coward. You deserve to know. Just then Nick walks up. He puts a protective hand on Kat back and shakes Jeffrey’s hand.  65.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, man.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Sorry, can you give us a moment?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No, I can’t. We’re late for a dance lesson. I guess you’1ll have to finish up later. Kat gives Nick an angry look as he pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat, furious, charges up the stairs--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hello, goodbye, I want you, I hate you. It’s all just words. None of it means anything. What matters is what you do. You either stay put or you walk away. If you look back, you’re not walking away!

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Oh, cut the crap!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I just hate seeing you so stuck.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: He was about to un-stick me! (hissing) I paid you to help me get closure.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You paid me for a lot of reasons. Closure wasn’t one of them. Kat is infuriated. She huffs and pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kat burst in, late. Glistening hardwood floors mirrored walls. Eyes closed and hands clasped, Amy and Ed stand in a circle with SONJA, late 50’s, the melodramatic dance teacher. Kat and Nick join the circle.  66.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Sorry. Sonja barely tolerates the interruption, closes her eyes breathes in deeply.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA
dialogues.text: The wedding dance is, sans doubte the most important dance-moment in a person’s life. Ed cracks open his eyes to see if anyone else thinks this a crock of shit. Nick catches Ed’s eye. Amy darts Ed a “p attention” look.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A room full of friends, family, enemies...watching, smiling, betting on how long the marriage will last. All you’1l have is each other and whatever skills you acquire today. Kat’s grip on Nick’s hand tightens. Ed cracks open his ey again. This time, he looks unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are people who will tell you that the wedding dance is symbolic of a couple’s compatibility. Ofa rapport that cannot be faked. That an unskilled man on the dance floor is a man who lacks grace in bed. (beat) These people are right. Sonja claps three times.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eyes open and pair off! They all open their eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Amy dance awkwardly to a standard as Sonja gives t instructions. ANGLE ON KAT AND NICK, dancing sedately, if awkwardly. Th is still tension between them. Kat, contrite, dares a gla into his eyes.  67.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I was such a bitch. I really appreciate your doing this.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (simply) It’s my job. Kat gazes deep into his eyes. A long look. The longest she’s been able to sustain since the boat. She can’t read him.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to Amy and Ed) She knows you better than anyone. You know her better than she knows herself. Where does that feeling live? I don't care if it's your heart, your head, or your crotch. Find that place and dance from it

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You know what pisses me off? I’ve been spilling my guts all weekend but I don’t know anything about you. Not one thing. Nick looks down at her, considering.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m allergic to fabric softener, I majored in Comparative Literature at Brown, and I think I’d miss you even if we had never met. Kat blinks, the power of his words hitting her hard. They dance a moment in silence. Now will you tell me how you became an escort? Nick smiles enigmatically. Then without warning-- NICK SPINS KAT AROUND, THEN REELS HER IN TIGHT. In a hyper-romantic cinematic flourish, THE FLOOR SWELLS AND THE WALLS DISAPPEAR. The music sharpens as if it’s no longer coming from an ol record player but from a classic MGM soundtrack.  68. Nick and Kat are weightless as they glide across the floo Their eyes stay locked on each other as though it were th connection, and not gravity, that keeps them on earth. Kat and Nick seem to slow down but the world stays at nor speed. ON SONJA, astonished. She stops and watches. ON AMY AND ED, as they notice what’s going on. They stop dancing and stare, too, slacked-jawed, as Nick and Kat fl past, completely wrapped up in each other. Nick and Kat are incredible together. The music CRESCENDOS as Nick gracefully spins Kat to a perfect stop.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: So you can’t dance, eh? Bloody liar. Nick and Kat crash back to earth. They stop dancing. The walls close in and the music sucks back into the speakers ED (CONT’D) I thought you said you were crap.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I had to say something to get you here.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Fair enough, but I’m stepping on toes here and you’re waltzing around like...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Fred Astaire and what’s her face!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s not me. I swear. It’s her She’s magic. Kat blushes. Sonja claps her hands, happily.

dialogues.speaker: SONJA
dialogues.text: And, switch partners!  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Kat, Amy, and Ed walk out of the studio. Ed skips d the steps and onto the street. Then he realizes what he’s doing and abruptly stops.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You’d better get going. My parents will be ‘round to cart you off to the country.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don’t mention Italy. Or politics. Or baby buggies. (beat) Or Edith Piaf.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Your probably best off pretending you’re asleep. Ed grabs Amy by the neck and pulls her away. Amy laughs but Kat catches a look on her sister’s face. I not quite nervousness. It’s something closer to panic. Am waves over her shoulder as they walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. KAT’S HOUSE - ST. JOHN’S WOOD Victor tows the boat with an annoyed Bunny in the passeng seat. As they pull out of the driveway, they wave to Nick who sits on a stone wall in front of the house. Nick talks on his cell phone, Kat’s bags piled high next him, as Pigeons walk and flap around him. Kat appears carrying two bottles of water. When Nick sees Kat, he hangs up too quickly. Kat pretends not to notice. She eyes the pigeons suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Pigeons creep me out. They’re like dirty doves...plotting something.  70. Nick playfully pulls Kat down next to him. Spooked by the increasing number of pigeons, Kat inches away from them a closer to Nick. Kat frowns, suddenly pensive.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do you have real relationships? You know, ones you don’t get paid for? Nick isn’t sure he wants to get into this.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have had girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sure, but it’s never easy. They say they’re okay with it, and they are...for a while. Then one day, they’re not. They sit in silence. It’s not awkward, it’s nice. London beams under a rare cloudless sky.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I said I’d never done a wedding before, I didn’t say that no one ever asked. I just never said yes.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: So, why’d you say yes to me?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There was something in your voice on the phone that day.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Desperation? Nick doesn’t acknowledge her joke. Kat sneaks a look at h

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think it was hope. Kat hides a smile as her leg touches his. They are both keenly aware of the contact.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What would you do if you weren't an escort?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Make out with you for free.  85 71. Nick puts his arm around her. Kat laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What would you do if you stopped worrying about what other people think?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Spontaneously combust? They sit in silence a moment. Just then, Ed’s parents dri up in a beautiful old Bentley. Ed’s mother reaches over h embarrassed husband and HOOTS the horn.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BENTLEY
dialogues.text: George drives through the lush countryside while Lydia 85 carries on. In the back seat, Kat drops her head on Nick’ shoulder; they’ve clearly been enduring this awhile. KAT, NICK, AND ED’S PARENTS -- SCENE FORTHCOMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Kat, and Ed’s parents unload the Bentley and carry their bags up the steps of a stately stone mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small boathouse sits at the edge of a charming lake tha borders the main property. Nearby, “Jack Ship” struggles say afloat as PASTY KIDS sun themselves on the moored jun Ed mans an elaborate grill as GUESTS in summer hats mill about. AT A PICNIC TABLE, Victor plays poker with Nick, Kat, and From the pile of money in front of him, it’s clear Victor kicking ass. Victor throws in ten pounds.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: (shrewd poker voice) You know, I might just call you... but if I did...I would lose... because my hand blows. She throws down her cards. Kat studies her hand and tosse ina bill.  72.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Call. All eyes are on Nick.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Let’s see what kind of a man my daughter’s found for herself. Nick looks down at his money. Ten pounds. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a HUGE WAD OF CASH. Everyone is shock but he doesn’t notice. He strips off a hundred, tos it in the pot, and takes back sixty.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Raise you thirty. Victor raises an eyebrow. ON TJ, looking at Nick. She leans over to Kat and whisper

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: (re: Nick’s penis) Can I see it? Just for a sec? Kat laughs and hits TJ. TJ (CONT’D) Come on, it’s so not fair. At least describe it to me. Just then, Nick's cell phone RINGS. Victor plucks the pho out of Nick's hand. Kat darts a worried look at Nick and reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Daddy! Victor won’t give it up. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: (into phone) I’m sorry, Nick's about to win a pile of my money. He's gonna have to call you back. Kat and Nick are frozen as Victor listens. VICTOR (CONT’D) Thank you for your understanding, ma’am. And good luck putting out that fire.  73. He hangs up the cell phone and looks quizzically at Nick. VICTOR (CONT’D) What is it you do again?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What would you say if I told you I was a member of an elite task force employed to safeguard our nation’s most precious resource: your daughter. Victor snorts.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, shrink. Call. Kat hides her relief. Victor throws in the cash. VICTOR (CONT’D) Let me save you some trouble. My old man hit the bottle like it was his job and he had a mean streak as wide as the English Channel. So, me? I drink in moderation and have never raised my voice around a kid. Kat throws in thirty pounds. Victor lays down a PAIR OF A AND TWOS. VICTOR (CONT’D) What do you say to that?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I say that feeling compelled to do the opposite of your parents is as enslaving as emulating them. Nick lays down his hand. THREE KINGS. Victor shakes his head. Nick glances at Kat. She twinkles at him, then lays down a LOW STRAIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: That’s my girl! She does a little dance as she swipes the pile of money toward her. Nick can’t believe it. VICTOR (CONT’D) Best thing about being a dad is when your kid starts kicking your ass--  74.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: --and the ass of the man who adores her. Nick rises from the table, but his comment lingers. Kat searches his face, wondering if he was serious. He holds gaze a moment, then begins picking up the cards. Ed appears holding a plate piled high with bangers.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Anybody seen my future-wife? (re: sausages) She’11 kill me if I don’t serve her first.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Have you guys ever had a real honest-to-God fight? Ed thinks about that.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (lying) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I hear that make-up sex is the best kind. Unfortunately, I’1l never know. Victor calls out to Nick--

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Hey, Sigmund, you think you could rustle up the bride and tell her to join the party?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Will do. Nick smiles at Kat and heads toward the boathouse. Kat watches with a hint of apprehension. FOLLOW NICK, walking across a carpet of pine needles. He passes through a latticework of shadows and steps into th boathouse- -  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK’S POV: Amy and Jeffrey, their backs turned, are in t middle of an argument.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (pulling her arm away) I said no! I’m getting married tomorrow! What do you want from me? Amy turns and sees Nick. Her face falls. Jeffrey sees him too, and blanches, then badly covers--

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Right, then. I’1l get youa Tofurky Burger instead. Jeffrey walks out stiffly and Amy, mortified, turns and stares blankly out the window.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt. Your dad sent me.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: To make sure you’re okay. Amy turns around and looks at the tiny boathouse. Althoug it had looked perfect to us before, under her gaze, we se all the cracks and dirt.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know all that “if these walls could talk” stuff? Do you believe it? That a place has a memory?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Actually, I do. Amy’s expression clouds as her eyes fall on the bedroom d Through the open door, Nick can see a small bed surrounde bookshelves.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This place has been in Ed’s family forever. We used to spend weekends out here every summer. (with a sigh) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY (cont'd) God, I hope it doesn’t remember everything. LAUGHTER floats in from outside, an ironic soundtrack to Amy’s desperation. Nick pushes out the chair across from him. Amy looks at h a moment, then sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is standing with her mother, absentmindedly looking f Nick, when Jeffrey approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: May I have a word? It’ll be just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: Let me think. You stole seven years of her life with your charm and your bullshit and now you want a couple more minutes? Sure. Go right ahead. As Jeffrey walks away, Kat whispers to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Thanks for the solidarity, but next time? A little less information. Kat follows Jeffrey toward the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy is now sitting across from Nick at the kitchen table. Nick is shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Does Kat know? Amy doesn’t even bother shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It was such a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Still--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If Ed ever found out....  77.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Or Kat....

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And she wonders why I swim to the bottom of a Lemondrop every time I see her. Nick pushes back from the table. He’s at a loss for words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey speaks to Kat with disarming sincerity. Kat tries keep her guard up, but despite herself, she’s listening.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: You were so good to me. I swear I never meant to hurt you. We were together what, five years?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Seven if you count the on-and-off years. Which I do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Right. Seven. (realizing) Christ, that’s a long time, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Not for a dog.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Well, we had a lot of good years but then... Jeffrey fumbles.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Is this supposed to be an apology?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: It’s not supposed to be anything, Kat. It’s just my rather feeble attempt to.... Oh, I don’t know. (beat) You see, I thought I could deny my feelings-- Something catches Kat’s eye: Nick exiting the boathouse. Even from this distance, she knows that something is wron  78. JEFFREY (CONT’D) You’re not even listening.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: When we were together I was “too here,” now I’m not here enough. FOLLOW KAT, as she walks away from Jeffrey through a stan trees and meets Nick. In the background, Jeffrey watches, confused, then walks away. Kat reaches out and touches Nick’s arm, tentatively

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Kat’s tenderness finds its way into Nick. It takes hima moment to recover.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Yeah. They look at each other a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kat walk back to the main house. Side by side, t cut through a picturesque glen. Nick shoots Kat an anxiou glance, deciding whether to reveal what he knows. Kat catches him and smiles back, sweetly. Nick takes her hand and kisses it, surprising her. His eyes turn back toward the house but he doesn’t let go of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is getting ready. She's up on her tiptoes, doing her make-up in the mirror. The radio is blaring Air Supply. K sings along, passionately, embarrassingly. Kat was clearly lying about not liking the cheesy greates hits. She knows every word. Somehow, she seems different freer. She's singing like she means it.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Victor, sipping cocktails, stand on a back balco overlooking the party preparations. In the backyard below Bunny zips around, hissing orders at the STAFF.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: You, with the hair and all the bright ideas. Paper lantern plus open flame equals no-no.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: That woman is insane. God damn if I don’t love her. Nick wants to come clean but can’t find the courage. He chooses his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Kat does this thing. She stands on her tiptoes when she’s looking in the mirror. You ever notice that? Victor smiles, he knows what Nick’s talking about.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I remember the day I met Kat. It was in New York. I’d been dating Bunny for a few months, and she finally trusted me enough to introduce me to her kid. So I’m over at her place and in walks this little monster that won’t stop talking. (remembering) She hands me a walkie-talkie made out of an orange juice can and drags me over to her fort. The fort was this lop-sided mess of blankets and the walkie-talkie almost took my ear off, but she was having the time of her life. (shaking his head) That was it. I was a goner. A wave of nostalgia passes over him. VICTOR (CONT’D) That was the day I became a dad. And from that moment on, I just knew. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR(cont 'd) I’d give that little girl everything she ever needed, I’d love her unconditionally, and I wouldn’t let her out of the house until she was thirty. Nick laughs. VICTOR (CONT’D) You think it’s going to get easier when they get older. That you’re going to worry about them less. Or trust the world more. But that’s just not how it goes. They stand in silence a moment.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m not sure if this is going to make sense to you, Sir, but I’d like to ask permission to date your daughter. Victor gives Nick an intense but unreadable look VICTOR (CONT’D) The ladies are fond of you, Nick. I can see that. I also see that whatever else you are, you’re a helluva good guy. (beat) She paid a real price dating Jeffrey. This will be different won’t it? Nick’s not sure what Victor knows. He wants to assure him to make promises. Instead, he says nothing. Victor and Ni look at each other, a silent understanding between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rehearsal dinner is underway. Strung with paper lanterns, the yard looks enchanted. The usual suspects ar packed around a candle-lit table, absorbed in lively conversation. Jeffrey, brooding, doesn’t engage, just dri heavily. At the center of it all, Nick is quietly relishing being part of this family dinner. Kat and Nick make eye contact They’ve finally caught up with the couple they were pretending to be at the beginning of the weekend. Bunny’s voice cuts through the din like a knife--  81.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: I blame Tony Pee-Pants!

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Oh, no. (to Nick) She tells this story at every major holiday.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: Why should this be any different? (taking Nick’s arm) Besides, I have to initiate Nick into the family. (to Nick) I blame Tony for why my two girls can’t seem to get along. Kat and Amy moan, here we go. BUNNY (CONT’D) Oh, don’t deny it. You barely tolerate each other.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: It’s true. All you have in common is that you both secretly want to be me. (raising her glass) Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (to Nick) She blames Tony Pee-Pants Pinterello for everything. The fall of the British Empire, the Cold war, the internet.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: It was just after we moved here. My little girls got in a fight over Tony Pee-Pants and they haven’t made up since. Amy rolls her eyes, saves them all from Bunny by telling story herself.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Apparently, Kat and I were inseparable.  82.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: If Kat ate a banana, Amy threw it up.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: If Amy threw it up, Kat ate it. Lydia is vaguely disgusted. She pulls a face. Bunny waves hand in front of her eyes. This story always kills her.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: We were eating and puking together in harmony until one day, Tony walked me home from school. He was my first boyfriend. (pointedly) I was fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So Tony Pee-Pants starts ignoring Kat. He wanted to play with me.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You practically bribed him with your erector set.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (aside, to Kat) Fourteen and he’s hoodwinked by a an erector set?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I didn’t say he was worth it. They share a private smile.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Whatever. The point is, Tony ended up with a chair in his face.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: (in her defense) It was plastic. And child-sized. But there were some stitches involved.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: Like fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Dad made me go over and apologize the next day.  83.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: I’m an American and in America, people sue. So to prevent a lawsuit, I baked a tart. And I don’t bake.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: So Dad rang the bell and when Tony Pee-Pants opened the door, I threw the tart at him and popped his stitches. Victor laughs, remembering. Bunny hits him on the arm.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Sorry. He chuckles again. VICTOR (CONT’D) You should have seen his face-- (he makes a surprised face) Then, boom. Right in the kisser.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) What happened to my little angels? Amy and Kat both ignore their mother, who’s misting up.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And that’s when he peed in his pants? After the tart?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: He bled a bunch, but no, there was no peeing.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So what’s with the nickname? They all think about that.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: I have absolutely no idea. Everyone laughs.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of the guests have gone. Empty bottles of wine litte the table. Only the immediate family, TJ, Nick and Jeffre remain. Jeffrey’s still drinking heavily and Kat’s not at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pulls a bottle of wine off the top shelf just as some comes up behind her. Kat feels a hand on her back, spins around and drops the bottle. Jeffrey reaches out and grab it before it drops. She looks at his somber face, takes t bottle, and sets it back on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s do this. What’s the big confession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks for Kat. Concern crosses his face as he notice that Jeffrey’s gone, too. Nick picks up a couple of empty wine bottles off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drops the bottles into a recycling bin then looks ov at the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands at the top of the cellar stairs. He’s eavesdropping, partially concealed by the half-open door.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, in a way, you were right. The prob was, you were in love. I wanted to be. But I wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I’d have confessed, you would have forgiven me. But the truth is, I didn’t want to be forgiven. I sort of just needed it to end.  85. Kat processes Jeffrey’s words, tries to be open. JEFFREY (CONT’D) Bollocks, I’m sorry. I had no idea this would be so difficult

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Relax. Take a breath and just say it. It’s no big deal. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Well, it was a big deal. As late as...yesterday. Or this morning. (beat) But not anymore. Nick smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you were right -- it is why I brought Nick with me...because I wanted to drive you insane. To torture you slowly, for the entire weekend. But then something happened. I started to fall for him. And now, and I hope this doesn’t hurt your feelings, now I’m sick of you and me, of our story. Nick, almost giddy with happiness, moves away from the do then back towards it again. Finally, he closes it quietly and leaves. Downstairs, Kat takes Jeffrey’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the past. It’s nothing but ghosts. So just get it off your chest, then let’s go back upstairs and eat some tiramisu.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I slept with your sister. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?  86.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I shagged Amy. Two years ago. That’s why I ended it. And then after you left, sod it, we kept at it like rabbits until we both realized it was absolutely mad. And, you know, morally wrong. Then there was that one other time. And that was it. Kat stares at him, blood pounding in her ears.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last Christmas when Ed proposed, I realized...I’m in love with her. I can’t lose her. She feels like she’s trapped in a horror movie. She’s got get out of here. In a daze, she turns around and heads toward the stairs. JEFFREY (CONT’D) What? Good lord, say something. You said I should tell you the truth. Kat stops dead, her jaw stiffens. When she turns and look at him, her face is filled with loathing.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I wasted two years grieving this? Kat laughs. It is so close to tears, that the sound catch in her throat. She shakes her head, wearily, and mechanically walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat emerges like a sleepwalker. She looks for Nick, doesn find him anywhere. She drifts toward the table. Jeffrey appears in the doorway behind her. TJ is the first to look up. She sees Kat’s face, sees Jeffrey, and knows what happened. TJ goes to Kat.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: Oh, no. He told you.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You knew?  87.

dialogues.speaker: TJ
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. Kat shakes her head and looks past TJ to Amy. Amy meets h sister’s gaze and instantly gets it. Desperate to keep th from Ed, she heads Kat off.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Please don’t say anything. Kat looks at Amy like they’ve never met. Amy’s eyes are wild, silently pleading.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Kat has never felt more alone. She looks everywhere for Nick. He finally emerges from the house and comes to Kat’s resc folding her in his arms. Kat holds onto him for dear life Then- -

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (to Nick) I can’t believe you told her! Kat pulls away from Nick, confused. As she stumbles backwards, all she sees is Nick’s face. All she hears is Amy’s voice, miles away.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You said your job was discretion. You couldn’t wait until you got back to New York? Bunny and Victor watch, confused, as Kat runs out. Nick r after her as Ed approaches Jeffrey.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Jeffrey looks straight at his best friend.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Doesn’t look like nothing. Jeffrey puts his arm around Ed.  88.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Now is not the time to catch on. (re: Ed’s empty glass) It is, however, time for another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat staggers down the moonlit lane. She’s barely staving a breakdown. Nick runs up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Kat! Kat charges forward, blindly, as Nick follows.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Don’t be-- Kat’s anger swells, she spins around.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What?! I can’t believe I trusted you! How could you not tell me!? Nick sees the pain in Kat’s face. It’s pain for Jeffrey, the past.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (angrily) Jesus, Kat. What did you want me to say? That your sister slept with your fiancé? That everybody knew and no one respected you enough to tell you? Nick is not used to being angry. He grows uneasy, hedges-

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides, you hired me for my discretion.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You’ve always got that to hide behind, don’t you? It’s just business!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah! For all I know, come Monday morning, we’ll go back to the real world and...and you’1l be hiring me for your best friend!  89. Kat’s face fills with hurt

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, come on. Did you actually think we’d be boyfriend and girlfriend? This stops Kat a moment, then-- Silence.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You let me make a fool of myself! You lied to me! I don’t know why that surprises me because lying is what you do. It’s your job. It’s who you are. How would you even know if something were real?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You’re judging me?! Oh, that’s a good one. You’re lying to me you’re lying to your family, and you’re lying to yourself. But you’re going to stand there and point a finger at me? The man you hired to pretend to be your boyfriend? Each wants the other to fight for it. But neither does. Kat gives up.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You’re right. I was so desperate to make everyone believe I was happy that I spent six grand ona lie. And after all that? The only one who ended up falling for it was me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Kat. Hate me. You were running out of steam on the whole Jeffrey thing. Maybe now you’1ll be able to hold onto this just long enough to ruin your next relationship. Nick’s had enough. He turns and walks away, leaving Kat stunned.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is over, the house lights low. Moonlight washes over Nick as he carries his packed suitcase to his car. E comes out of the house, jogs up to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’1l just check into a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Don’t be ridiculous. It’s late and the place is empty. Just take my car. Ed hands him a set of keys. ED (CONT’D) I don’t know what’s going on with you two, but I’m sure it’1l work out. You couldn’t be more perfect for her if she picked you out of a catalogue. Nick smiles, wearily.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. Nick tosses his bag in back and gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands at the window, her eyes puffy. She watches as Nick drives away, then she turns around. Her mom and dad wait in the darkened living room. Kat tri to be strong, but then she goes to her father, burying herself in his arms. Bunny hides a pang of disappointment she gently touches Kat’s head. INT. KAT’S ROOM - FLETCHER-WOOTEN ESTATE - LATER Kat straightens up her room. A KNOCK on the door and Amy walks in.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Hey.  91. Kat keeps cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say thank you. For not outing me in front of Ed. I want to tell him. Just not on the night before our wedding. With these kind of things, timing is everything. Kat turns on her sister, she’s smiling.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You’re right. You should really time it right so when he hears that you repeatedly screwed his best friend, he doesn’t feel like the world is collapsing around him and there’s no escape because you tricked him into marrying you. Amy wasn’t ready for Kat’s intensity, she backs towards t door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m not having this conversation right now.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Sure, disappear. We’ve been walking away our whole lives. Amy turns around and faces Kat, willing to hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not even going to discuss the fact that you screwed my fiancé because you’ve always been a spoiled, amoral, little princess. Amy looks horrified but Kat’s not backing down.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I put up with all of it because I really believed that deep down, you loved me and you were a good person. I really thought you deserved someone like Ed. God I envied you guys. Somehow, he made your selfish bullshit seem okay. Almost endearing. Amy looks at Kat with tears in her eyes.  92.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now I know. You didn’t deserve any of it. You were just lucky. Kat looks at her sister, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, Amy. Your wedding will be perfect. Tomorrow, I’11 smile and say all the right things and you’1l deal with Ed when you’re ready. But right now, tonight, I can’t pretend it’s okay. Amy, stricken, exits. As she leaves, her shoulders start shake. She is crying. Kat’s reflex is to go to her, but s stops herself. It’s too soon to forgive. She walks over a closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands, alone in the darkened boathouse, speaking on cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And that’s the first flight out? He writes something down on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, thank you. He hangs up and sits down on the edge of the bed. He look at the floor. At nothing. INT. KAT’S ROOM - FLETCHER-WOOTEN ESTATE Kat lies in bed. She stares at the ceiling. At nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KAT’S ROOM - FLETCHER-WOOTEN ESTATE - MORNING Kat’s eyes flutter open. She’s not refreshed and she does feel better. The only thing that’s changed is that it’s morning. Kat looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m okay.  93. CU ON KAT’S FACE, STARING INTO CAMERA. SHE SEES NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat’s make-up is flawless and her hair is perfect but her eyes are clouded with pain and sleeplessness.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you. Bunny sits next to Kat in a barber’s chair.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: No, I’m fine, really. Nothing a bottle of Jack and a straight razor can’t fix. Kat’s trying to be light, but her eyes are a dead giveawa Kat draws in a long breath, trying to summon some semblan of joy.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, it doesn’t matter. Today’s Amy’s day. She braves a glance at her mother’s face. Bunny’s not buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat stands in the car park behind the salon, furtively sucking on a cigarette as she pulls off an old nicotine patch. Choking, she throws down the cigarette as the salo door opens and Bunny steps out.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: What’s going on with you two?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I was pretty hard on her last night. (welling up) And now she’s getting married.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: There’s a reason I always tell that Tony Pee-Pants story, you know.  94.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Trust me. This is bigger than Tony Pee-Pants.

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: (pressing on) Before Tony, you and your sister were best friends. I couldn’t split you up. If your sister ate the spinach, you ate the spinach. If you threw up--.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Mom, please. BUNNY (CONT’D) Anyway, when that boy came over, it was the first time you ever did anything without her. (beat) And Amy wasn’t just jealous...she was sad and lonely. She missed you.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: She did?

dialogues.speaker: BUNNY
dialogues.text: So she flirted with Tony, and you got mad and sent him away. who did that leave? (beat) You and Amy. Reunited. Kat stands, stunned, as Bunny brushes her hand against Ka cheek. BUNNY (CONT’D) I wish I had known it would go by so fast. Kat watches, full of emotion, as Bunny leaves with tears her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of images as Wedding preparations transform the austere church. A carpet is unrolled down the aisle. A bouquet is affixed to a pew. Programs are laid out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 112 95. A HAND ZIPPING UP A SUITCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag in hand, Nick locks up the boathouse and sets the key top of the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limos wait outside both Kat’s house and the house next do Bunny fusses with Amy’s dress as they walk toward the car Victor and Kat follow, arm in arm. ANGLE ON VICTOR AND KAT. Victor looks at Kat, who is tryi to be brave. It’s almost working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy nervously fusses with her dress when Kat walks in. Ka stops when she sees her sister, glowing in a beam of dust light. It takes Kat’s breath away.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Wow. You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Most important day of my life. Whatever. Listen, I chose you to be my Maid of Honor for a lot of reasons: I love you, you’re my favorite, and only, half-sister blah blah blah. But the main reason I picked you is because you’ve been so miserable for the past few years, I knew you wouldn’t outshine me. (beat) But here it is, my big day. My big day. And something doesn’t feel right. Maybe it was that pep talk you gave me last night, I don’t know, but your misery just isn’t working for me anymore. Amy tries to keep up her tough attitude but when she leve her gaze at Kat, her eyes cloud with a regret deeper than thought her capable of.  96.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was a horrible thing I did to you. I’m really sorry. Amy takes her sister’s hand. Then lets it drop.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you hate when I get what I want. But right now, all I want is for you to be happy. ON KAT as this sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pushes open the heavy church doors. Organ music flood out as Kat surreptitiously looks up and down the street. Victor appears behind her. Kat looks at her dad and force smile. Victor knows she’s upset.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: So why’d you let him go?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: It’s complicated, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: (ironically) Oh, well, then. It probably won’t work out. Victor stops and faces her, his voice full of meaning. VICTOR (CONT’D) I read a fascinating article in the New Yorker once and this guy said: “Every woman has the exact love life she wants.” You know what? I agree. And I refuse to believe that this is what you want. Kat is overwhelmed but Victor continues. VICTOR (CONT’D) Ever since you were a little kid, you’ve been trying to please other people. And in return for your services, all they’ve done is disappoint you. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR(cont'd) So tell me, is this the guy for you? Kat thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Then for once in your life, do something for yourself. Kat looks at him gratefully and makes a silent decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat speeds down the road in her parents’ car. The empty b trailer clatters behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy watches through a crack in the door as the GUESTS tak their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy paces nervously. Ed knocks and enters, covering his e so he doesn’t see her dress.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Your mother said you’d like a quick word. Amy takes Ed’s hands away from his eyes. From the look on her face, Ed knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat races through the woods, trying to keep her dress fro catching on the branches that whip at her on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guests are all seated now, and the organ has begun it mood music. In the atrium just outside the church, the entire wedding party, minus Amy and Ed, is gathered, wait  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat bursts into the clearing, her hair tousled, her dress nightmarish. She tries to catch her breath as she looks u to the porch of the boathouse. This is supposed to be the part where she sees Nick and they live happily ever after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat desperately searches the rooms of the boathouse. By t time she gets to the kitchen, she knows it’s going to be empty. She opens the door, anyway. Nick’s gone. On the kitchen table, a_brown envelope. Kat picks it up. Written on the front: KAT. She turns it over to open it. On the back it reads: “IT’S ALL THERE, TRUST ME.” Kat laughs at how well Nick knows her. Her eyes fill with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the car, Nick’s face is stoic as he drives, his ca on on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy faces Ed, her eyes red and puffy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I was too scared to tell you. I thought you’d never speak to me again. I’m so sorry. Ed is reeling, he just stares at Amy, saying nothing. Amy finally doing her penance. The silence is killing her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say something. Please.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I knew you were still seeing someone else when we finally got together. I never in a million years would have dreamt it was Jeffrey. Ed shakes his head, trying to understand.  99. ED (CONT’D) Does Kat know?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jeffrey told her last night.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Last night? Ed winces, remembering, then lets out a growl. ED (CONT’D) That worthless bastard! Ed staggers towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed slams the door on his way out of the annex. He charges the aisle, past the pews full of guests. Guests MURMUR in surprise. Ed picks up speed. He's like a heat-seeking missile that's found its mark: JEFFREY, stands at the back, chatting up a DUMPY BRIDESMA He turns just in time to see Ed running up the aisle. TJ spots Ed, too. Jeffrey’s seen this movie before -- he knows he’s about t get his ass kicked. Jeffrey drops everything and starts running. At that mome TJ grabs a FLOWER GIRL and uses the little girl to trip Jeffrey. He falls, scrambles back up and keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat trudges up the church steps, her head down. Just then the door bursts open and Jeffrey flies out of the church races down the street. Moments later, Ed explodes from th church and takes off after Jeffrey. Kat watches them run down the street, confused, then goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick’s staring straight ahead when something STREAKS PAST HIS WINDOW.  100. Nick thinks he’s seeing things, looks in the rear-view mi to investigate. Just then, ANOTHER FORM STREAKS PAST. Nick looks out the back window and sees Ed chasing Jeffre down the street. Nick shakes his head, but keeps driving. This family is not his problem anymore. Nick wills his eyes to stay on the road, but then he can’ help it. He looks into the rear-view mirror again. Almost despite himself, Nick throws the car into a U-turn He catches up and pulls alongside Ed, who’s still chasing Jeffrey.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey. Ed looks over at Nick, but keeps running, his tuxedo flailing. Nick keeps pace.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (winded) I look like a total wanker, don’t

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, kind of. Ed keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only way to beat that guy is to take yourself out of the game. Ed finally stops running. Wheezing, he bends over to catc his breath. Nick pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside, Amy nervously awaits her fate. Kat enters. S wants to hug Amy, but offers her a tissue instead. Amy ta it gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Ed pull up to the church. Nick turns off the car Neither one of them gets out.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You heading to the train station?  101.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I figured you could pick up your car tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah. They sit in silence, the church looming in front of them. ED (CONT’D) I felt sorry for you last night. I was sitting there like some smug arse thinking how lucky I am. Ed’s clearly struggling. Nick lets him talk. ED (CONT’D) I forgave her when I thought it was just some bloke. Bugger it. Why Jeffrey? (beat) I’ve had her up on a pedestal ever since...since the day I put her up there. It’s going to take a long time for me to get over this. Nick tries to find the right words of encouragement. Finally, he takes his best shot

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Think about it this way: you get to spend the rest of your life having make-up sex. Ed thinks on this a moment. Then he turns to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Listen, mate, are you coming to this wedding or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat pushes open the heavy doors to take one last look. Sh steps outside and the door closes, revealing-- NICK, now dressed in his tux. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Hi.  102. They take each other in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: When we were fighting last night, it hit me. No one had ever cared about me as much as you cared about Jeffrey. That’s why I was so angry. I’m sorry I took it out on you -- I didn’t mean to hurt you. (beat) And then, I was going to get out of here and leave you alone, but halfway to the station, I realized-- From inside, the WEDDING MARCH begins to play. Nick takes her face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’d rather fight with you than make love to anyone else. Kat is speechless. Nick leans down and kisses her like he going to keep on kissing her forever. But then, he breaks away .

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What?! No, no. You can’t--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I have to. (he smiles) I’m the best man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kat stand in a dark doorway, facing the closed d They share a secret smile in the dark. Just then, the USHER opens the door and Nick leads Kat do the aisle. As they walk, they exchange sidelong glances. Both are as nervous and excited as school kids. Behind them, Victor and Amy beam as they await their turn Nick leans over and whispers in her ear.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Amy and Ed stand at the altar. They ho hands tightly, grateful to have lost and found each other Nick and Kat peek across at each other. They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Today is a day for love and for beauty. But most of all, it's a day for truth.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat speaks into a microphone, trying to deliver her speec All around her, she sees faces: Mom, Dad, Amy, Ed, TJ. Ka looks down at a crumpled scrap of paper.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’ve been working on this speech since these two got engaged. It was supposed to be touching and funny. Kat looks at Nick. He doesn’t have to do anything. He jus is support.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I’d come back to England and have an epiphany. I’d see Amy and the perfect thing would pop into my head and it would encapsulate how and why I love my sister. But I came home and everything was a mess and the truth and beauty line was all I could come up with. (beat) And I think I stole that from the back of an in-flight magazine. The GUESTS laugh. Kat looks at her mom.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A wonderful woman once said about Amy: “It’s not that I love her more, it’s that she lets me love her.” Kat raises her glass in a toast  104.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ed and Amy) It can be the scariest thing in the world to let someone love you and to know how to love them back. Take good care of each other. I love you both. Everyone clinks glasses. A few people sniffle or kiss the dates. Kat and Amy hold each other’s gaze. Nearby, Bunny watches her little girls with tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAFF has already started packing up. Ed’s Father whispers something to the BANDLEADER and pulls his wife o on the dance floor. He spins her around as “Ma Vie en Ros begins to play. She smiles, happily, as they dance. Ed tries to keep a very drunk Amy away from the present table. Slouching on the piano, TJ makes out with her date Woody, the bartender. The CAMERA FINDS Kat and Nick on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nice speech. I thought it was “touching”... and “funny.”

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Thank you. Nick gracefully spins Kat around; they really do dance beautifully together.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since I’ve generously agreed to go out with you, I think it’s only fair that you tell me how you got into the business? Kat smiles mischievously. Nick pulls her close. He’s finally going to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You know why I never tell the real story of how I got into this? Kat shakes her head, "no." Nick swings her around in an elaborate dip and kisses her on the neck.  105.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because it’s boring. (Kat laughs) Now if you want to hear a good story, let me tell you the one about how I got out of it. Kat and Nick smile at each other as their dancing grows m effortless. In the background, Ed tugs a half-opened pres out of Amy’s hands and puts it back on the table. She jum up on his back and he happily carts her off to the loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WORKER finishes counting the money, closes the envelope and tucks it in his pocket. The CAMERA PULLS BACK as he walks over to TWO OTHER WORKE who are scraping paint off a hoisted-up “JACK SHIP.” As the first star appears in the night sky, the music swe and we slowly make out the sounds of the greatest make-up of all time, echoing in the distance. FADE TO BLACK.
